DataElement.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether a patient receives anticoagulant medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredDefinition: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If required, will warfarin use be within the parameters described in section 5.5.1 of protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving full anti-coagulant therapy with Coumadin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concurrent use of anticoagulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, such as low-molecular-weight heparin or warfarin, are they on a stable dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy including, heparin or low molecular weight heparin, warfarin, clopidogrel, ibuprofen and other NSAIDS, tirofiban, and other anticoagulants, drugs, or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on full dose anticoaugulation, has patient been on a stable dose for at least 14 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy including, include heparin or low molecular weight heparin, warfarin, clopidogrel, ibuprofen and other NSAIDS, tirofiban, and other anticoagulants, drug or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is therapeutically treated with an agent such as warfarin or heparin, are they on a stable dose of their medication and INR/PTT remains stable within the recommended therapeutic range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received NSAIDs, clopidrogel, dypiridamole or aspirin therapy within one week prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is therapeutically treated with an agent such as warfarin or heparin, are they on a stable dose of their medication and INR/PTT remains stable within the recommended therapeutic range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on a stable dose of anti-coagulation therapy, patient has no signs of bleeding or clotting and the INR/PT and PTT/aPTT results are compatible with an acceptable risk-benefit ratio as per the investigator's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is being therapeutically treated with an agent such as warfarin or heparin, is their medication dose and international normalized ratio (INR)/PTT stable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving low and high-molecular weight heparins, is platelet count maintained at greater than 30,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is therapeutically treated with anticoagulation including warfarin, is the patient`s medication dose and INR/PTT stable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will patient be able to take aspirin 81mg daily or a substitute thromboprophylaxis such as low molecular weight heparin at a prophylactic dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require therapeutic doses of anticoagulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are Factor Xa inhibitors (i.e., rivaroxaban, apixaban, betrixaban, edoxaban otamixaban, letaxaban, eribaxaban) or Factor IIa inhibitors (i.e., dabigatran)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
